name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: FINALLY (for real this time), please have this in mind: I fit into what people would call "a genius". But do I fit the stereotype? No. I'm a woman. I hate numbers. I basically can't do math. I don't play chess. Stereotypes are stereotypes. And people are more than that.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: ... look good in color. Pretty cool, isn‚Äôt it?

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: That explains my attention to detail, my grasp of how colors work, and as I mentioned, my ability to "visualize" black and white photographs in color - something I use to determine which photos to work on since this ‚Äúskill helps me to predict whether or not the photos will...

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: I was diagnosed as "twice exceptional," which refers to people who have a disability but also have a high level of intelligence and skills in a certain area of interest. In my case, I can visually process information in a totally different way.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: I can even explain WHY I CAN "SEE" BLACK AND WHITE PHOTOS IN COLOR! And you people following me here should know that I'm pretty sure I wouldn't be able to do what I do without my autism.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: There's no cure for autism. You are born autistic, and you will die autistic. But it doesn't matter, because now I KNOW who I am. I can understand my struggles and be more respectful towards myself.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
This is not about being "labeled". It's about having a chance to know who you really are, and why. That changes everything.

For the first time in my life, I felt a sense of recognition.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
Looking back now, knowing what I know now, it was obvious. All signs were there.

Finally, let me tell you: the diagnosis was a HUGE relief. When I found out I was autistic, everything clicked into place inside my head.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
I grew up feeling weird and maybe even stupid, all while hearing from everyone around me that I was a "genius." 

To sum it up, my life was hell when I needed to socialize, but I excelled at a lot of things when I was alone. Can you see the contradictions and the shitshow?

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: As I grew older, I could speak different languages, including English, without making any effort or taking any lessons. I could literally spend hours writing excellent articles about anything. I would read three books at the same time.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: I didn't have the same interests as other folks my age. Teachers mocked me in front of everyone because I couldn't stand up from my chair and answer their questions. I was punched several times by little assholes.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
I've always LOVED to study, but only if I could do it alone. School was a living horror.

I was so interested in history, while all of my classmates were discussing the newest episode of a Nickelodeon show. I felt like an alien. I didn't belong anywhere.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
I believe it is important to mention a few more characteristics that should have caught the attention of my doctors and psychologists at the time.

I could read when I was 4. And no one ever taught me that. By the age of 5, I was already writing my own silly little book.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
... something that had never, ever crossed my mind before. And that wasn't because I wanted to die or to kill myself, but because the medication I was on, which wasn't the correct choice for my "problem," was the one who set off the trigger.

It was a VERY scary experience.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: (trigger warning) Worse still, I was offered a variety of medications that ended up making me feel worse. In fact, just a year or two before I met the doctor who would literally save my life by diagnosing me correctly, I was overwhelmed with suicidal thoughts...

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: I saw maybe 6 other psychologists throughout the years, as well as a dozen different psychiatrists. They all had different explanations for my behavior and psychological issues, but none of them were correct. I was misdiagnosed several times.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: My mother took me to the psychologist for the first time when I was 3, to investigate my (bizarre) anxiety. That was merely the beginning of a lengthy journey that would not stop until 2020, when I was diagnosed at the age of 26.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
Of course, there are exceptions. There are many professionals that are open, knowledgeable, and understanding (shout out to my doctor). The big question is: where and how can we find them?

This is exactly what happened to me.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Unfortunately, what happens most of the time is that professionals and the so-called experts also have those preconceptions and stereotypes in mind, and they are not prepared to look into the small details of what the person is saying and establish the link.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
You have those (girls included!!) who are extremely clever and can do miracles when placed in front of a computer yet are unable to tie their shoes or to pick up the phone without having a panic attack. 

They are all autistic.

PEOPLE are different.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: You do have the young boy who finds it tremendously difficult to engage with others and make friends, and you do have the "geniuses". But you also have those who are literally unable to talk.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: In our community, there is a well-known quote that says "if you know an autistic person, you know ONE autistic person." The fact that you've met an autistic person at some point in your life doesn't make you an autism expert.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: However, autism goes well beyond these assumptions, which is why it is called a spectrum (Autism Spectrum Disorder). https://t.co/AGyDbZkikV

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
Basically, people have two scenarios in mind: you can't be autistic if you're not a young boy bouncing in the corner with your dinosaur, with no friends at all and exhibiting a ""strange"" behavior. 

Or, you can't be autistic if you're not a genius. Remember Rain Man? https://t.co/QpvOyCjUYK

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
Of course, this is NOT the only reason. But those movies have added an extra layer of problems to an already complicated situation. 

They have created stereotypes.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
If you are a woman, it will be even harder for you. I'm not exaggerating. Millions of women are being misdiagnosed as we speak, and we have a few things to blame, including popular culture and films like "Son-Rise: a Miracle of Love". 

https://t.co/owQYEUJB0Y

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: I'd like to start by saying that getting a diagnosis is not easy, especially as an adult. If you reached adulthood without one, chances are you have "subtle signs" of autism, which are subsequently misdiagnosed as anxiety, depression, schizophrenia and even borderline disorder.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
(Autism, late diagnosis, stereotypes, personal experience, popular culture... Follow the üßµ)

I spoke yesterday at a corporate event about my late diagnosis and felt inspired to share here a little bit of what I said. So...

name: Marina Amaral

tweet:
Blind Tom's final years were spent holed up in Eliza Bethune's house in Hoboken, New Jersey, which had been purchased with Wiggins's earnings. 

He died of a stroke on June 13, 1908, at the age of fifty-nine. https://t.co/nmndNxZi7s

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: After the Civil War (1861-65) Bethune's son, John, took over the management of Blind Tom, and he used Wiggins's considerable income to support his own extravagant lifestyle.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
... and claiming that the sounds of nature had taught him the melodies. 

Wiggins's lack of emotional development coupled with extraordinary musical ability made him prime for exploitation.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: From his earliest years "Blind Tom," as he became known, could mimic many kinds of sounds, from birdcalls to trains, with unbridled and uninhibited enthusiasm. In time he would incorporate such effects into his musical works, imitating wind and rain, for example...

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Wiggins's demanding tour schedule often included four performances a day, and as he grew into a large man, his graceful precision stunned audiences.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Piano lessons were provided for him, and Wiggins's ability quickly surpassed that of his teachers. Bethune recognized his talent as a potential source of income, and Wiggins was hired out at the age of nine or ten to a traveling showman named Perry Oliver. https://t.co/E0le0iWQFk

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: The Bethune family had seven musically gifted children who played piano or sang, and Wiggins stood by, rapt, as the children practiced. Soon, he began reproducing the music he heard on the keyboard.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Wiggins's mother interceded to save his life, and several months later Wiggins, his two older siblings, and his parents were sold at auction to General James Bethune, a Columbus lawyer.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Thomas Greene Wiggins was born near Columbus on May 25, 1849, to Charity and Domingo Wiggins, slaves who were owned by Wiley Jones. After discovering that the infant was blind, Jones refused to feed or clothe him.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Thomas "Blind Tom" Wiggins was one of the most famous American entertainers of the 19th century. Blind from birth and born into slavery, Wiggins became well known for his piano virtuosity. Though undiagnosed at the time, it is likely that he was autistic as well. https://t.co/5chvv4TOEM

tweet:
This is why my autism isn‚Äôt a superpower (and it isn‚Äôt a burden either). 

It‚Äôs a disability that makes our lives way harder than neurotypicals would ever understand.

name: Marina Amaral

tweet: One of the hard things of being autistic is the inability to do things that you are very aware that are important to you (finishing an assignment, answering an email,etc) but you simply can‚Äôt do it without a great deal of suffering. And not knowing why makes you suffer even more.

tweet: The 39 wagons that came to Treblinka on 19 August 1943 were carrying at least 7,600 survivors of the Bia≈Çystok Ghetto Uprising.

name: Marina Amaral

tweet: The last two rail transports of Jews were brought to the camp for gassing from the Bia≈Çystok Ghetto on 18 and 19 August 1943. They consisted of 76 wagons (37 the first day and 39 the second).

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Willenberg and Taigman emigrated to Israel after the war and devoted their last years to retelling the story of Treblinka. Escapees Hershl Sperling and Richard Glazar both suffered from survivor guilt syndrome and eventually killed themselves.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Taigman died in 2012 and Willenberg in 2016. Taigman stated of his experience, "It was hell. A normal man cannot imagine how a living person could have lived through it ‚Äì killers, natural-born killers, who without a trace of remorse just murdered every little thing."

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Among the Jewish prisoners who escaped after setting fire to the camp, there were two 19-year-olds, Samuel Willenberg and Kalman Taigman, who had both arrived in 1942 and had been forced to work there under the threat of death.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Of those who broke through, around 70 are known to have survived until the end of the war, including the future authors of published Treblinka memoirs: Richard Glazar, Chil Rajchman, Jankiel Wiernik, and Samuel Willenberg.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Partisans of the Armia Krajowa (Polish: Home Army) transported some of the surviving escapees across the river, while others ran 30 kilometres (19 miles) and were then helped and fed by Polish villagers.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Machine-gun fire from about 25 Germans and 60 Ukrainian Trawnikis resulted in near-total slaughter. About 200 Jews escaped from the camp. Half of them were killed after a chase in cars and on horses.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: At 3:45 p.m., 700 Jews launched an insurgency that lasted for 30 minutes. They set buildings ablaze, exploded a tank of petrol, and set fire to the surrounding structures. A group of armed Jews attacked the main gate, and others attempted to climb the fence.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: The conspirators silently unlocked the door to the arsenal near the train tracks, with a key that had been duplicated earlier. They had stolen 20‚Äì25 rifles, 20 hand grenades, and several pistols, and delivered them in a cart to the gravel work detail.

tweet:
The number of prisoners incarcerated in Dachau between 1933 and 1945 exceeded 200,000.

The number of prisoners who died in the camp and the subcamps between January 1940 and May 1945 was at least 28,000. It is unlikely that the total number of victims will ever be known.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: As the Allies neared the camp on April 29, they found more than 30 railroad cars filled with bodies brought to Dachau, all in an advanced state of decomposition. In early May 1945, American forces liberated the prisoners who had been sent on the death march. https://t.co/OGicSudOVb

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: As units approached, at least 25,000 prisoners were force-marched south or transported away from the camps in freight trains. During these so-called death marches, the Germans shot anyone who could no longer continue; many also died of starvation, hypothermia, or exhaustion. https://t.co/tqh5gMun48

Ball died on December 31, 1916, at age 24. She had become ill during her research, and it has been suggested that the cause may have been chlorine poisoning due to exposure while teaching in the laboratory.

- https://t.co/FvnTgFreJq

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: In the 1970s, Kathryn Takara and Stanley Ali, professors at the University of Hawaii, searched the archives to find Ball's research. After numerous decades they were able to bring her efforts and achievements to light, giving her the credit she earned.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: It was not until years after her death that Hollmann attempted to correct this injustice. He published a paper in 1922 giving credit to Ball, calling the injectable form of the oil the "Ball method." Unfortunately, she still remained forgotten in the scientific record.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: ...  after treatment with injections of Ball's modified chaulmoogra oil. The isolated ethyl ester remained the preferred treatment for leprosy until sulfonamide drugs were developed in the 1940s.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Dean published the findings without giving Ball credit and named the technique after himself. In 1920, a Hawaii physician reported in the Journal of the American Medical Association that 78 patients had been discharged from Kalihi Hospital by the board of health examiners...

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: Arthur L. Dean, a chemist and later the president of the University of Hawaii, stole her work, published the findings, and began producing large quantities of the injectable chaulmoogra extract.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: ...  and was absorbed by the body when injected. Unfortunately, due to her untimely death, Ball was unable to publish her revolutionary findings.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: At age 23, Ball developed a technique to make the oil injectable and absorbable by the body. Her technique involved isolating ester compounds from the oil and chemically modifying them, producing a substance that retained the oil's therapeutic properties...

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
Alice Augusta Ball was an American chemist who developed the "Ball Method", the most effective treatment for leprosy during the early 20th century.

These are my rules.

name: Marina Amaral

tweet: Of course, there are several ethical points to consider. I don't speak for the others, but I do speak for myself. Research is paramount. Distortion/manipulation of the original is forbidden. Objects shouldn't be added or removed. The historical context needs to be preserved.

tweet: Under her direction, the world's first studies were conducted into the treatment of neoplasms by the use of radioactive isotopes. In 1920 she founded the Curie Institute in Paris, and in 1932 the Curie Institute in Warsaw; both remain major centers of medical research.

tweet: In 1906 Pierre Curie died in a Paris street accident. Marie won the 1911 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for her discovery of the elements polonium and radium, using techniques she invented for isolating radioactive isotopes.

tweet: In 1903, Marie and Pierre Curie were awarded half the Nobel Prize in Physics. The citation was, ‚Äúin recognition of the extraordinary services they have rendered by their joint researches on the radiation phenomena discovered by Professor Henri Becquerel.‚Äù

They were both against doing so.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
Many autistic women and girls are still struggling to get the support they need. It took me 25 years to have my diagnosis (less than a year ago).

https://t.co/FzDoo3bEn2

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
Yes, it's nice to recognize the "positive" things that autism can offer to some, but many have no chance of experiencing anything positive at all. 

And even those who do (which is my case), still go through a lot of suffering every day.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet: There are millions who can't even speak. It is a disability (sometimes "invisible", yes, but still a disability) and it needs to be validated as such.

name: Marina Amaral
description: Passionate about history. Exclusive content from me on https://t.co/MmWoX1eZrK ‚ú® Bestselling author ‚ú® agent: @GeorginaCapel ‚ú® @forbesunder30 #actuallyautistic
tweet:
Happy #AutismAcceptanceDay - maybe it would be a good idea to accept and listen to us every day, and outside of social media as well.

Autism is not a superpower because not all autistic people have what you guys call a superpower.
